Enquire about recent stressful event that may have led to worsening of clinical condition and take measures to reduce stress. » Review symptoms to rule out physical and/or other priority MNS conditions. Go to PSY 1, see STEP 1 Consider risperidone as an alternative to haloperidol or chlorpromazine, if cost and availability are not constraints. If the person does not respond to adequate dose and duration of more than one antipsychotic medication, using one medicine at a time, then antipsychotic combination treatment may be considered; preferably under the supervision of a specialist, with close clinical monitoring. Consider consultation with a specialist for the use of clozapine in those who have not responded to other antipsychotic medications at adequate doses and durations. Only use clozapine under the supervision of a specialist and only if routine laboratory monitoring is available, due to the risk of life-threatening agranulocytosis.
